description: The Old Vestry Office is a Grade II listed building that was built in the early 19th century. It was originally created as a Beadle's office but later used as a police station, containing 2 cells. The Old Enfield Charitable Trust - an independent charity serving those living and working within the boundary of the Ancient Parish - run their services from the Old Vestry Office.

events.name: Royal Charter to the hidden prison cell of Enfield
events.notes: Creative workshop suitable for all ages.

factsheet.heading: Royal Charter to the hidden prison cell of Enfield
paragraphs: An art workshop by Toni Fielding reflecting on the Old Charitable Trust, based in the Old Vestry. From the royal charter to the holding police cell inside, participants will use drawing, collage, paint and quotes to explore what the building is,  its purpose and what it means to people now.
This event is part of Enfield Creativesâ€™ Collection.
This co curated Collection has been made possible with support from the Enfield Society and UKSP funding.

location.address: Old Enfield Charitable Trust, The Old Vestry Office, 22 The Town

name: Royal Charter to the hidden prison cell of Enfield
